titleStmt.title: Shinkin's misfortune: or, The poor Welsh taylor kidnapt [sic] for stealing a goose, leek and a cock-gelding. To a tune of Teague and Sawney: or, Lilliburlero. Liscensed according to order.
Shinkin's misfortune: or, The poor Welsh taylor kidnapt [sic] for stealing a goose, leek and a cock-gelding. To a tune of Teague and Sawney: or, Lilliburlero. Liscensed according to order.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for J. Deacon at the Angel in Gilt-Spur-Street,

notesStmt.note: Place and date range of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.).
First line: Shinkin ap shone was rob a creet house.
Printed in black letter in three columns.
Reproduction of original in: National Library of Scotland--Crawford Collections.
